journals.notes: I've updated the test server to the latest version. 64-bit omni-bot segfaults on the server. I haven't investigated why yet.

journals.notes:
I've checked the Win installer. Good to go!

The full Linux installer is online in etlegacy-tools. The official 32bit static version is missing on the mirror before being able to test it. I think it isn't worth to add support for the 64 bit version now (at least not until OB 64bit is ready).

I've uploaded all the available 2.71a builds to http://mirror.etlegacy.com/release:

* etl_bin_v2.71a.pk3
* etlegacy-2.71a-linux-i686.tar
* etlegacy-2.71a-linux-x86_64.tar
* etlegacy-2.71a-x86.exe
* etlegacy-2.71a-x86.zip
* pak3_v2.71a.pk3

Still missing OS X bundle.

Radegast wrote:
> * etlegacy-2.71a-linux-i686.tar
> * etlegacy-2.71a-linux-x86_64.tar

Any reason why these aren't gzipped? Could you use the binaries in dropbox (readypackages/linux)? The 32 bits version is huge due to OB files.
Done. I just copied them without the proper extension.
Thanks. I updated the Linux static installer script (etlegacy-tools), and tested it. Good to go!
The news is out, installers are out and we are now working on the .1 patch
